Documentation.name: DAF
Documentation.notes: Initial version created on 13-Jan-2016. Added all shapes. Added Icons. Modified Delta to Lowercase (S type symbol) from Upper case (triangle) 3.0.0.M: Added diagram and remaining toolbox profiles. 3.0.0.N: Added all the quick linker for component creation. 3.0.0.O - Added quick linker for existing components and modified icons. 3.0.0.P - updated with views and tool boxes. 3.0.0.Q - updated with Default size and colors 3.0.0.R - Added table, model and physical service and quick linker for the components. 3.0.0.S - Added modified icons and represented them on top right corner. Changed component default representation to custom representation. 3.0.0.T-Updated Quick Linker with self composition to the elements. Linked Value and ValueRef to Class and added it to the MDG Profile. 3.0.0.U - Added scripts for generation of controller class for the use case from package and diagram. 3.0.0.V - removed some types (in rejected package), added missing types and tagged values (User Story, dDeploymentNode, dProgram) 3.0.0.W - Changed the background and foreground color for Business Partner Active to check the output. 3.1 - new revamped 2018 version updated to Sparx 14 3.1.3 added Event 3.2 Updated for EA 14.1 3.3 update to comply with TOGAF 9.2 3.3.8 fixed quicklinker, diagrams 3.3.9 added Application Investment disposition 3.3.12 added KPI tagged value 3.3.15 Added Dots for evaluation 3.4 added masked types for tagged values 3.4.2 consolidated actors, shape script 3.4.5 consolidated colors 3.4.10 shape script functions 3.5 adding additional shape script functions 4.0 Alpha 2 changed based class for dOrganization (actor don't support icon shape???) 4.0 Alpha 3 added diagram patterns 4.0 Beta quicklink generated with M3 and fixed

Stereotype.name: dAction
Stereotype.notes: A specialized activity.

Stereotype.name: dActivity
Stereotype.notes: A function or work carried out by the business user.

Stereotype.name: dInitiative
Stereotype.notes: An activity carried out by a Business Unit or organization to achieve a particular goal or improve the Maturity of a certain capability.

Tag.name: DetailedDescription
Tag.description: Detailed Description of the initiative.

Tag.name: Impacted Capability
Tag.description: Describes the contribution this work package makes to capability delivery.

Tag.name: RelatedProgram
Tag.description: The Growth Package or Program associated to the Initiative.

Tag.name: startDate
Tag.description: The start date for the initiative.

Tag.name: finishDate
Tag.description: The finish date of the initiative.

Tag.name: InitiativeDuration
Tag.description: The expected duration of the initiative in Months/ Weeks or Years.

Tag.name: kind
Tag.description: To capture the type of initiative.

Tag.name: purpose
Tag.description: Purpose of the initiative.

Tag.name: Rank
Tag.description: The rank of the initiative.

Tag.name: Description
Tag.description: Description for the initiative.

Tag.name: initiativeStatus
Tag.description: a set of colors to Visually describe the health of the initiative.

Stereotype.name: dBusinessProcess
Stereotype.notes: A business Processes represent a sequence of activities that together achieve a specified outcome, can be decomposed into Business Services. It ensures the correct operation of business capabilities.

Tag.name: Category
Tag.description: User-definable categorization.

Tag.name: ID
Tag.description: Unique identifier for the architecture entity.

Tag.name: LastStandardReviewDate
Tag.description: Last date that the standard was reviewed.

Tag.name: NextStandardReviewDate
Tag.description: Next date for the standard to be reviewed.

Tag.name: Owner
Tag.description: Owner of the architecture entity.

Tag.name: ProcessCriticality
Tag.description: Criticality of this process to business operations.

Tag.name: ProcessType
Tag.description: Whether this process is supported by IT or is a manual process.

Tag.name: ProcessVolumetrics
Tag.description: Data on frequency of process execution.

Tag.name: RetireDate
Tag.description: Date when the standard was/will be retired.

Tag.name: Source
Tag.description: Location from where the information was collected.

Tag.name: StandardCreationDate
Tag.description: If the product is a standard, when the standard was created.

Stereotype.name: dBusinessService
Stereotype.notes:
1. A repeatable activity; a discrete behavior that a building block may be requested or otherwise triggered to perform.
  2. . A service provided by Business that achieve a business outcome in response to a request.

Tag.name: Category
Tag.description: User-definable categorization for Business Service.

Tag.name: ID
Tag.description: Unique identifier for Business Service.

Tag.name: LastStandardReviewDate
Tag.description: Last date that the standard was reviewed.

Tag.name: NextStandardReviewDate
Tag.description: Next date for the standard to be reviewed.

Tag.name: Owner
Tag.description: Owner of the architecture entity.

Tag.name: RetireDate
Tag.description: Date when the standard was/will be retired.

Tag.name: Source
Tag.description: Location from where the information was collected.

Stereotype.name: dApplicationComponent
Stereotype.notes: An encapsulation of application functionality aligned to implementation structure which is modular and replaceable. It encapsulates its behavior and data, provides services, and makes them available through interfaces.

Tag.name: ID
Tag.description: Unique identifier for the element, useful for referring to third party systems

Tag.name: Category
Tag.description: User-definable categorization taxonomy for each element.

Tag.name: BizSatisfaction
Tag.description: How much is the business happy with the application, expressed in 1-100

Tag.name: ITSatisfaction
Tag.description: how is IT happy with this application, often related to technical debt.

Tag.name: BizCriticality
Tag.description: how is Business happy with this application, often related to business debt.

Tag.name: Cost
Tag.description: the cost of this application in 1000 of $

Tag.name: ApplicationType
Tag.description: the type of Application, e.g. if it's a COTS, Custom and so on

Tag.name: LastStandardReviewDate
Tag.description: Last review date for the application component.

Tag.name: NextStandardReviewDate
Tag.description: Next review date for the application component.

Tag.name: RetireDate
Tag.description: The retire date for the Application Component.

Tag.name: Owner
Tag.description: The owner for the application Component.

Tag.name: Source
Tag.description: The original source of the element's information

Stereotype.name: dLogicalAppComponent
Stereotype.notes: An encapsulation of application functionality that is independent of a particular implementation.

Stereotype.name: dProduct
Stereotype.notes: Output generated by the business. The business product of the execution of a process.

Tag.name: ID
Tag.description: Unique identifier for the Product.

Tag.name: Owner
Tag.description: Owner of the Product.

Tag.name: Source
Tag.description: Location from where the information was collected.

Stereotype.name: dSystem
Stereotype.notes: A system configuration. Settings are modeled as attributes with default values

Tag.name: config
Tag.description: The configuration file where the settings will be placed.

Tag.name: plattform
Tag.description: The plattform to which the configuration settings apply.

Stereotype.name: dGrowthPackage
Stereotype.notes: A set of actions identified to achieve one or more objectives for the business. A work package can be a part of an Initiative, a complete project, or a part of a Program. A Growth pack is a collection of Initiatives architected for consistency and aimed to be executed in the same period.

Stereotype.name: dBusinessUseCase
Stereotype.notes: A Business Use Case is part of a business process that produces an advantage to the enterprise.

Tag.name: GoalInContext
Tag.description: The goal should implicitly express the actor's intent or purpose of the use case, such as "Enrol Student in Seminar."

Tag.name: Precondition
Tag.description: A list of the conditions, if any, that must be met before a use case may be invoked. Can be a previous Use case or self the presence of the system in Scope.

Tag.name: Trigger
Tag.description: Event that is responsible for invocation of the use case.

Tag.name: Scope
Tag.description: Boundaries in which the use case is operated when invoked (E.g. CMS)

Tag.name: Level
Tag.description: Authorizations for operations/actions to be performed against the Chi business objects in scope. Against every object/process 4 CRUD basic operations are possible: Create (Write) Read (Open) Update (Change) Delete (Destroy)

Tag.name: OtherActors
Tag.description: The list of actors associated with the use case. Although this information is contained in the use case itself, it helps to increase the understandability of the use case when the diagram is unavailable.

Tag.name: MainSuccessScenario
Tag.description: The main path of logic an actor follows through a use case. Often referred to as the "happy path" or the "main path" because it describes how the use case works when everything works as it normally should.

Stereotype.name: dRequirement
Stereotype.notes: A Business guide line about the Enterprise or the project.

Tag.name: ID
Tag.description: Unique identifier for the requirement.

Tag.name: Author
Tag.description: This requirement's author's name and role in the project

Tag.name: Status
Tag.description: the status of the Requirement in the workflow.

Tag.name: Priority
Tag.description: A priority in %. Requirements are ordered by priority.

Tag.name: Proofreader
Tag.description: Each requirement needs to be confirmed. This requirement's proofreader 's name and role in the project

Tag.name: Type
Tag.description: The type of requirement.

Stereotype.name: dAccord
Stereotype.notes: Opinion that is in sync with another opinion

Stereotype.name: dCapability
Stereotype.notes: A business outcome that is current available in an Organization Unit (or) A business-focused outcome that is delivered by the completion of one or more work packages.

Tag.name: BusinessValue
Tag.description: assess how this capability provides value to the enterprise.

Tag.name: Category
Tag.description: User-definable categorization for Capability

Tag.name: ID
Tag.description: Unique identifier for the Capability

Tag.name: Owner
Tag.description: Owner of the architecture entity.

Tag.name: Source
Tag.description: Source from where the information was collected.

Tag.name: Increments
Tag.description: Current (AS-IS) maturity level for the entity. 0- none 1- Initial 2- UnderDevelopment 3 - Defined 4- Managed 5 - Measured

Tag.name: IncrementsToBe
Tag.description: Future (To-Be) maturity level for the entity.

Tag.name: IncrementVertical
Tag.description: The maturity level of your vertical (the industry)

Tag.name: IncrementSupplyChain
Tag.description: The maturity level of your supply chain (Partners)

Tag.name: Cost
Tag.description: the aggregated cost of this Capability. Includes all the aggregated cost's elements

Tag.name: Criticality
Tag.description: What is the criticality of this capability, what would be the cost of failure

Tag.name: Risk
Tag.description: How much Risk connected to this business Capability. 1 low risk, 100 max risk.

Tag.name: CapabilityLevel
Tag.description: the level of this category in the hierarchy

Stereotype.name: dController
Stereotype.notes: The Controller defines application behavior and the Business Logic involving more than one ModelClass. It dispatches requests and selects views for presentation. It interprets user inputs and maps them into actions. Controller, with Views and Associations define the application flow. A controller represents the Business logic where a certain flow is physically implemented. In a Service Oriented Architecture (SOA) a Controller can be exposed by a Physical Service.

Stereotype.name: dDataEntity
Stereotype.notes: An encapsulation of data that is recognized by a business domain expert as a thing. Logical data entities can be tied to applications, repositories, and services and may be structured according to implementation considerations.

Tag.name: PrivacyClassification
Tag.description: Level of restriction placed on access to the data.

Tag.name: RetentionClassification
Tag.description: Level of retention to be placed on the data.

Tag.name: Category
Tag.description: User-definable categorization.

Tag.name: ID
Tag.description: Unique identifier for the Data Entity.

Tag.name: Owner
Tag.description: Owner of the Data Entity.

Tag.name: Source
Tag.description: Location from where the information was collected.

Stereotype.name: dDiscord
Stereotype.notes: A disagreement on some Opinion

Stereotype.name: dFeature
Stereotype.notes: A Feature is a fact that set his related Requirement to be true

Tag.name: Author
Tag.description: This feature's author's name and role in the project

Tag.name: Proofreader
Tag.description: This feature's revisor's name and role in the project

Tag.name: Status
Tag.description: This feature's status

Stereotype.name: dGoal
Stereotype.notes: A measurable scope that the enterprise wants to achieve. Can be hierarchically decomposed.

Tag.name: ID
Tag.description: Unique identifier for the Goal.

Tag.name: Value_amount
Tag.description: The actual amount of the value this goal intends to alter

Tag.name: Value_Goal
Tag.description: The amount by which the value is to be altered

Tag.name: Priority
Tag.description: A priority in %

Tag.name: Value_Name
Tag.description: The name of the value this goal intends to alter

Tag.name: dAssumption
Tag.description: The assumptions made to achieve the goal.

Stereotype.name: dIssue
Stereotype.notes: A concrete problem that is affecting a business. Also a fact that sets a Requirement to be false.

Tag.name: Author
Tag.description: This issue's author's name and role in the project

Tag.name: Responsible
Tag.description: The responsible to close the present issue

Stereotype.name: dMeasurementArea
Stereotype.notes: The organisation or Business units performance objective is captured as measurement area.

Tag.name: ID
Tag.description: Unique identifier for the Measurement Area.

Tag.name: Definition
Tag.description: Definition of the Measurement Area.

Stereotype.name: dMeasurementCategory
Stereotype.notes: The category to be measured under a measurement area.

Tag.name: MeasurementArea
Tag.description: The reference Measurement Area to which this category belongs to.

Tag.name: Definition
Tag.description: Definition of the measurement category.

Tag.name: ID
Tag.description: Unique identifier for the Measurement Category.

Stereotype.name: dMeasurementGrouping
Stereotype.notes: Categorization of measurement indicators into various groups under a measurement category.

Tag.name: MeasurementCategory
Tag.description: Related Measurement Category to which the group belongs to.

Tag.name: Definition
Tag.description: Definition of the Measurement Grouping.

Tag.name: ID
Tag.description: Unique identifier for the Measurement Grouping.

Stereotype.name: dMeasurementIndicator
Stereotype.notes: The specific measure captured for a Organization or Business Unit which can be measured and quantifiable.

Tag.name: ID
Tag.description: Unique identifier for the Measurement Indicator.

Tag.name: Definition
Tag.description: Definition of the Measurement Indicator.

Tag.name: UnitOfMeasure
Tag.description: The unit of measure (if available) for the Measurement Indicator.

Tag.name: CurrentLevel
Tag.description: the level of the Measurment Indicator the last time that was measured.

Tag.name: SatisfactionLevel
Tag.description: Satisfaction level for the Measurement Indicator, desidered amount to be reached and/or Max value

Tag.name: LastStandardReviewDate
Tag.description: last time this KPI was reviewed

Stereotype.name: dObject
Stereotype.notes: A dObject is a candidate for a dModelClass represented in an activity diagram. In alternative can be an instance of a Model Class

Stereotype.name: dObjective
Stereotype.notes: A time-bounded milestone for an organization used to demonstrate progress towards a goal. The Objective is a non material achievement, other than a Goal, the objective has no specific value to be measured

Tag.name: Category
Tag.description: User-definable categorization.

Tag.name: finishDate
Tag.description: the date in which the objective is achieved.

Tag.name: ID
Tag.description: Unique identifier for the Objective.

Tag.name: Owner
Tag.description: Owner for the Objective.

Tag.name: Source
Tag.description: Location from where the information was collected.

Stereotype.name: dOpinion
Stereotype.notes: A view or judgment formed about a Topic. That is formulated in an explicit fashion

Stereotype.name: dOpinionInner
Stereotype.notes: A Stakeholders opinion that is relevant for the topic but is not formulated explicitly.

Stereotype.name: dPrinciple
Stereotype.notes: A qualitative statement of intent that should be met by the architecture. Has at least a supporting rationale and a measure of importance.

Tag.name: PrincipleID
Tag.description: Unique identifier for the Principle expressed as text.

Tag.name: Implications
Tag.description: Statement of what the principle means in practical terms.

Tag.name: PrincipleMeasurement
Tag.description: Identifies mechanisms that will be used to measure whether the principle has been met or not.

Tag.name: Priority
Tag.description: Priority of this principle relative to other principles.

Tag.name: Rationale
Tag.description: Statement of why the principle is required and the outcome to be reached.

Tag.name: Statement
Tag.description: Statement of what the principle is.

Tag.name: Type
Tag.description: The category of the principle.
Tag.values: Guiding Principle,Business Principle,Data Principle,Application Principle,Integration Principle,Technology Principle

Tag.name: Owner
Tag.description: Owner for the Principle

Tag.name: Source
Tag.description: Location from where the information was collected.

Stereotype.name: dView
Stereotype.notes: A View used in DAF. Controller, Views and Associations define the application flow

Stereotype.name: dDecision
Stereotype.notes: A decision-making step with accompanying decision logic used to determine execution approach for a process or to ensure that a process complies with governance criteria. documents important decisions about any aspect of the initiative including the structure of the system, the provision and allocation of function, the contextual fitness of the system and adherence to standards.

Tag.name: Subject Area
Tag.description: Area of Concern

Tag.name: Topic
Tag.description: Topic of Interest

Tag.name: Assumptions
Tag.description: What is believed to be true about the context of the problem, constraints on the solution.

Tag.name: Motivation
Tag.description: Why this decision is important.

Tag.name: Alternatives
Tag.description: A list of alternatives and explanations

Tag.name: Decision
Tag.description: The decision taken, possibly with references to related work products

Tag.name: Justification
Tag.description: Why the decision was made and a list of compliance to Architecture Principles and explanations of deviations from compliance.

Tag.name: Implications
Tag.description: What impact the decision will have

Tag.name: RelatedDecisions
Tag.description: A list of related decisions

Stereotype.name: dManyToMany
Stereotype.notes: A many to many node used in DAF. It is used to realize a many to many relation between two Nodes.

Stereotype.name: dPhysicalService
Stereotype.notes: the physical realization of a Business Service

Stereotype.name: dTable
Stereotype.notes: a physical Table in a Database

Tag.name: Database
Tag.description: The DB schema hosting the table

Stereotype.name: dValue
Stereotype.notes: A Node value type used in DAF. These values are persistent

Tag.name: app_data_type
Tag.description: The datatype used in the application e.g. DATATYPE_DONTCARE, DATATYPE_ATTRIBUTE, DATATYPE_ELEMENT or DATATYPE_IGNORE

Tag.name: db_data_type
Tag.description: The datatype used in the database

Tag.name: is_editable
Tag.description: Whether the attribute is editable or not

Tag.name: input_type
Tag.description: The HTML input type for the attribute e.g. select#fix:key1[val1]|key2[val2]

Tag.name: display_type
Tag.description: The HTML display type for the attribute e.g. image

Tag.name: restrictions_match
Tag.description: A regular expression that the value must match (e.g. '[0-3][0-9]\.[0-1][0-9]\.[0-9][0-9][0-9][0-9]' for date values)

Tag.name: restrictions_not_match
Tag.description: A regular expression that the value must NOT match

Tag.name: restrictions_description
Tag.description: A text describing the restrictions

Tag.name: column_name
Tag.description: The name of the database column. If not given the name will be taken

Stereotype.name: dLocation
Stereotype.notes: A place where business activity takes place and can be hierarchically decomposed.

Tag.name: AreaCode
Tag.description: The area code of the Location.

Tag.name: City
Tag.description: The City of the Location.

Tag.name: Country
Tag.description: The City of the Location.

Tag.name: EmailID
Tag.description: The contact e-mail Id for the Location.

Tag.name: PhoneNumber
Tag.description: The contact phone number for the Location.

Tag.name: Province
Tag.description: The Province of the Location.

Tag.name: Street
Tag.description: The street part of the Location.

Tag.name: ID
Tag.description: Unique identifier for the Location

Stereotype.name: dResource
Stereotype.notes: a type of Asset supporting a Business capability

Stereotype.name: dUserStory
Stereotype.notes: a requirement expressed from the user point of view that achieve a business value

Tag.name: TestScenario
Tag.description: The situation that verifies the user story is realized

Tag.name: EstimatedEffort
Tag.description: Effort expressed in hours

Stereotype.name: dDeploymentNode
Stereotype.notes: a deployment node represents a physical or a virtual machine.

Tag.name: IP
Tag.description: The Ip of this machine

Tag.name: CPU
Tag.description: the number and type of CPU

Tag.name: RAM
Tag.description: the Memory dimension

Tag.name: Owner
Tag.description: THe owner / responsible for this node

Tag.name: ArchitectureType
Tag.description: the type of CPU Architecture (e.g. AMD 64)

Tag.name: Disk
Tag.description: the dimension of the disk

Stereotype.name: dProgram
Stereotype.notes: a set of Initiatives that can be organized in Growth Packages

Stereotype.name: dStakeHolder
Stereotype.notes: Any person or force that have an interest in the considered domain. This is typically indicated by name, can be connected with a Role in the organization. A stakeholder has open and Inner opinions that are relevant for the subject matter.

Tag.name: Legitimacy
Tag.description: Measure the degree of general acceptance of this stakeholder influence

Tag.name: Power
Tag.description: the measure of the possibilities in context that this person has to realize his objectives.

Tag.name: Urgency
Tag.description: the timely importance of the Stakeholder opinions

Stereotype.name: dActor
Stereotype.notes: The actor entity used for representing a User, System, a Worker or Partner.

Tag.name: #FTEs
Tag.description: Estimated number of FTEs that operate as this Actor.

Tag.name: ActorGoal
Tag.description: Objectives that this actor has, in general terms.

Tag.name: ActorType
Tag.description: the type of Actor
Tag.values: Not Set,Worker,External Worker,Internal Worker,Business Partner,Active Business Partner,Passive Business Partner

Tag.name: ActorTasks
Tag.description: Tasks that this actor performs, in general terms.

Stereotype.name: dOrganizationUnit
Stereotype.notes: A self-contained unit of resources with line management responsibility, goals, objectives, and measures. Organizations may include external parties and business partner organizations.

Tag.name: HeadCount
Tag.description: Number of FTEs wor king within the organization.

Tag.name: ID
Tag.description: Unique identifier for the Organization Unit.

Stereotype.name: dRole
Stereotype.notes: The usual or expected function of an actor, or the part somebody or something plays in a particular action or event. An actor may have a number of roles.

Tag.name: #FTEs
Tag.description: Number of Full time Equivalent employees working in the Role.

Tag.name: User
Tag.description: User-definable categorization.

Tag.name: ID
Tag.description: Unique identifier for the Role .

Tag.name: Owner
Tag.description: Owner of the Role.

Tag.name: Source
Tag.description: Location from where the information was collected.

Stereotype.name: dModelClass
Stereotype.notes: Represent a class of the domain model, that can be converted into a Persistent domain class, must inherit from Node. It is the application's dynamic data structure

Tag.name: child_order
Tag.description: The order of the associated children e.g. for Recipe: Image|Info|AdminInfo

Tag.name: display_value
Tag.description: The display value of a node e.g. for Recipe: name|AdminInfo/status|Info/status

Tag.name: initparams
Tag.description: The configuration section that is used on initialization of the corresponding mapper.

Tag.name: is_searchable
Tag.description: Indicates wether this type should be included in the default search.

Tag.name: is_soap
Tag.description: Indicates wennever an interface (e.g SOAP or REST) should be generated for this type.

Tag.name: orderby
Tag.description: Definition of default sorting. Possible values: 'none' (no order), 'sortkey' (generates a 'sortkey' column, that is used for explicit sorting) or any the name of any dValue defined in the node optionally followed by [ASC|DESC] e.g. 'name ASC'

Tag.name: parent_order
Tag.description: The order of the associated parents.

Tag.name: pk_name
Tag.description: The name of the primary key column. The generator will add this if there is no appropriate attribute.

Tag.name: table_name
Tag.description: The name of the database table. If not given the name will be taken.

Stereotype.name: dValueRef
Stereotype.notes: A Node value type used in DAF that reference another Node Value, similar to a foreign Key. These values are persistent

Stereotype.name: dEvent
Stereotype.notes: An organizational state change that triggers a business process; may originate from inside or outside the organization and may be resolved inside or outside the organization.

Tag.name: Category
Tag.description: User-definable categorization.

Tag.name: ID
Tag.description: Unique identifier for the Event.

Tag.name: Owner
Tag.description: Owner of the Event.

Tag.name: Source
Tag.description: Location from where the information was collected.

Stereotype.name: dValueStream
Stereotype.notes: A representation of an end-to end collection of value-adding Business Processes that create an overall result for a customer, stakeholder or end user

Tag.name: Criticality
Tag.values: Not Analyzed,Negligible Impact,Limited Impact,Moderate Impact,Noticeable Impact,Significant Impact

Stereotype.name: dAssociation
Stereotype.notes: A type of relation between two architecture entity.

Stereotype.name: dEnsureCorrectOperationOf
Stereotype.notes: A relationship entity used to represent the correct operator relationship.

Stereotype.name: dRisk
Stereotype.notes: the potential for an Issue

Property.name: _MeaningBackwards
Property.value: Ensure the correct Operation of Capability

Stereotype.name: dApplicationFunction
Stereotype.notes: a logical Function that the application is supporting

Stereotype.name: dActionKey
Stereotype.notes: Associates two ChiController instances (to define a control flow) or a ChiView with a ChiController (to define a view attachment), must be one directional

Tag.name: action
Tag.description: The action, which is triggered by this Dependency. If empty, any action is valid

Tag.name: method
Tag.description: the operation name assigned to the target of this action key, if left empty the operation name will be equal to the action name.

Tag.name: context
Tag.description: The context, in which this association is valid. If empty, any context is valid. e.g. when 2 controllers are linked twice

Tag.name: config
Tag.description: The configuration, in which this association is defined

Tag.name: decorator
Tag.description: Allows to dynamically attach special behaviors to the result operation without changing his implementation . e.g. a decorator REST, will expose this endpoint as a REST service.

TaggedValueType.description: the main actor of this use case
the main stakeholder for this Use case
